job_role: Software Development Engineer II, HST Health Foundation
Experience: 3+ years of non-internship professional software development experience and 2+ years in design or architecture of scalable systems
Eligible: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent
job_summary: As a Software Development Engineer II at HST Health Foundation, you will design and build secure, reliable, and scalable engineering solutions for Amazon’s healthcare technology platform. The role demands deep technical expertise, problem-solving at the architecture stage, and high-quality standards to deliver impactful healthcare services.
role_detailes: Design, architect, and develop scalable and reliable software systems to support healthcare technology products.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define solution spaces for well-defined business problems.
Ensure secure and high-quality code through reviews, standards adherence, and best engineering practices.
Contribute to ideation, design discussions, and long-term architecture strategies.
Participate in operational excellence by monitoring, debugging, and improving system reliability.
Rapidly solve ambiguous problems using modern technologies and engineering practices.
Drive technical initiatives that contribute to the long-term vision of Amazon Healthcare products.
Note: Amazon never asks for fees or deposits in any form during the recruitment process. Job seekers are advised to safeguard themselves from fraudulent job offers.
mandatory: Minimum 3+ years professional software development experience, 2+ years system design or architecture experience, and proficiency in at least one programming language.

job_role: Software Dev Engineer I, Amazon University Talent Acquisition
Experience: Entry-level (0-2 years), internship or project experience preferred
Eligible: Bachelor’s degree or above in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field
job_summary: As a Software Development Engineer I with Amazon University Talent Acquisition, you will design, code, and build innovative technologies from scratch to solve large-scale distributed computing challenges. This role is aimed at fresh graduates or early-career engineers who want to create impactful products, features, and services with mentorship and hands-on exposure to Amazon’s ecosystem.
role_detailes: Collaborate with senior Amazonians on product ideation, design, and implementation.
Develop distributed, scalable, and fault-tolerant systems in a large-scale computing environment.
Run predictions, indexing, and querying at scale using distributed technologies.
Write clean, high-quality, and maintainable code for well-defined problem statements.
Participate in agile development and deliver in short, rapid development cycles.
Learn to handle ambiguous challenges and abstract problem spaces while building software systems.
Note: Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. Amazon never asks for fees or deposits during recruitment. Safeguard yourself from fraudulent offers.
mandatory: Strong fundamentals in computer science (OOP, data structures, algorithms, complexity analysis, problem solving) and proficiency in at least one language (C/C++, Java, Python, or Perl).

job_role: Software Development Engineer III, Prime Video Content Localization and Accessibility
eligible: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent (preferred, not mandatory if experience is strong)
job_summary: As an SDE III in Prime Video’s Content Localization & Accessibility team, you will lead the design and development of scalable solutions that enable multilingual and accessible content for customers worldwide. This role requires leadership in system architecture, coding, and mentoring, while innovating with GenAI-based automation and human-in-the-loop systems to improve speed, quality, and compliance of video accessibility offerings.
role_detailes: Lead design and architecture of large-scale distributed systems for localization and accessibility features in Prime Video.
Innovate with GenAI to generate multilingual assets (subtitles, captions, audio descriptions) at scale.
Build workflow management tooling, automation pipelines, and optimized human-in-the-loop solutions.
Mentor junior engineers, act as Tech Lead, and review design/code to ensure system reliability and scalability.
Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements for accessibility (captions, audio descriptions) across global territories.
Collaborate with product, design, and cross-functional teams to deliver high-impact solutions for international customer experience.
note: Prime Video is expanding inclusivity by building industry-first accessibility solutions like Dialogue Boost. Regulatory compliance and customer obsession drive innovation in this team.
mandatory: At least 5 years of hands-on software development, programming expertise, and demonstrated leadership in system design/architecture. Experience mentoring or leading engineering teams is essential.
skills_expected: Reliability and Scaling of Distributed Systems
Backend Development (Java, Python, C++, or similar)
Full SDLC experience (coding standards, reviews, version control, testing, operations)
